text: Cookies, Flash Cookies and Web Beacons    Like many websites, we use cookies, flash cookies, web beacons or similar technologies. We use cookies for a variety of purposes, including remembering you and your preferences, tracking your use of our Sites, and facilitating your payment transactions. Most web browsers automatically accept cookies, but, if you prefer, you can usually modify your browser setting to decline cookies. However, please note that refusing a cookie may limit your access to the Sites.

If you choose to adjust your Flash privacy settings in your device, some features of the Sites may not function properly. text: A "web beacon" (also known as an "action tag", "tracer tag", or "single-pixel GIF") is an invisible graphic that is programmed only to collect non-personal information about your use of our Sites or emails sent to you.
